dom-notification-notification.name: Notification
dom-notification-notification.summary: The Notification() constructor creates a new Notification object instance, which represents a user notification.
dom-notification-notification.title: Notification: Notification() constructor

dom-notification-actions.name: actions
dom-notification-actions.summary: The actions read-only property of the Notification interface provides the actions available for users to choose from for interacting with the notification.
dom-notification-actions.title: Notification: actions property

dom-notification-actions.name: action
dom-notification-actions.summary: Returns the string ID of the notification button the user clicked. This value returns an empty string if the user clicked the notification somewhere other than an action button, or the notification does not have a button. The notification id is set during the creation of the Notification via the actions array attribute and can't be modified unless the notification is replaced.
dom-notification-actions.title: NotificationEvent: action property

dom-notification-badge.name: badge
dom-notification-badge.summary: The badge property of the Notification interface returns the URL of the image used to represent the notification when there is not enough space to display the notification itself.
dom-notification-badge.title: Notification: badge property

dom-notification-body.name: body
dom-notification-body.summary: The body read-only property of the Notification interface indicates the body string of the notification, as specified in the body option of the Notification() constructor.
dom-notification-body.title: Notification: body property

dom-notification-onclick.name: click_event
dom-notification-onclick.summary: The click event of the Notification interface fires when the user clicks on displayed Notification.
dom-notification-onclick.title: Notification: click event

dom-notification-close.name: close
dom-notification-close.summary: The close() method of the Notification interface is used to close/remove a previously displayed notification.
dom-notification-close.title: Notification: close() method

dom-notification-onclose.name: close_event
dom-notification-onclose.summary: The close event of the Notification interface fires when a Notification is closed.
dom-notification-onclose.title: Notification: close event

dom-notification-data.name: data
dom-notification-data.summary: The data read-only property of the Notification interface returns a structured clone of the notification's data, as specified in the data option of the Notification() constructor.
dom-notification-data.title: Notification: data property

dom-notification-dir.name: dir
dom-notification-dir.summary: The dir read-only property of the Notification interface indicates the text direction of the notification, as specified in the dir option of the Notification() constructor.
dom-notification-dir.title: Notification: dir property

dom-notification-onerror.name: error_event
dom-notification-onerror.summary: The error event of the Notification interface fires when something goes wrong with a Notification (in many cases an error preventing the notification from being displayed.)
dom-notification-onerror.title: Notification: error event

dom-notification-icon.name: icon
dom-notification-icon.summary: The icon read-only property of the Notification interface contains the URL of an icon to be displayed as part of the notification, as specified in the icon option of the Notification() constructor.
dom-notification-icon.title: Notification: icon property

image-resource.name: image
image-resource.summary: The image read-only property of the Notification interface contains the URL of an image to be displayed as part of the notification, as specified in the image option of the Notification() constructor.
image-resource.title: Notification: image property

dom-notification-lang.name: lang
dom-notification-lang.summary: The lang read-only property of the Notification interface indicates the language used in the notification, as specified in the lang option of the Notification() constructor.
dom-notification-lang.title: Notification: lang property

dom-notification-maxactions.name: maxActions_static
dom-notification-maxactions.summary: The maxActions attribute of the Notification interface returns the maximum number of actions supported by the device and the User Agent. Effectively, this is the maximum number of elements in Notification.actions array which will be respected by the User Agent.
dom-notification-maxactions.title: Notification: maxActions static property

dom-notification-permission.name: permission_static
dom-notification-permission.summary: The permission read-only property of the Notification interface indicates the current permission granted by the user for the current origin to display web notifications.
dom-notification-permission.title: Notification: permission static property

dom-notification-renotify.name: renotify
dom-notification-renotify.summary: The renotify read-only property of the Notification interface specifies whether the user should be notified after a new notification replaces an old one, as specified in the renotify option of the Notification() constructor.
dom-notification-renotify.title: Notification: renotify property

dom-notification-requestpermission.name: requestPermission_static
dom-notification-requestpermission.summary: The requestPermission() static method of the Notification interface requests permission from the user for the current origin to display notifications.

notes: From Firefox 70 onwards, cannot be called from a cross-origin iframe.
From Firefox 72 onwards, can only be called in response to a user gesture such as a click event.
From Firefox Android 79 onwards, cannot be called from a cross-origin iframe.
From Firefox Android 79 onwards, can only be called in response to a user gesture such as a click event.

safari.notes: Only supported the deprecated callback syntax.

dom-notification-requestpermission.title: Notification: requestPermission() static method

dom-notification-requireinteraction.name: requireInteraction
dom-notification-requireinteraction.summary: The requireInteraction read-only property of the Notification interface returns a boolean value indicating that a notification should remain active until the user clicks or dismisses it, rather than closing automatically.
dom-notification-requireinteraction.title: Notification: requireInteraction property

dom-notification-onshow.name: show_event
dom-notification-onshow.summary: The show event of the Notification interface fires when a Notification is displayed.
dom-notification-onshow.title: Notification: show event

dom-notification-silent.name: silent
dom-notification-silent.summary: The silent read-only property of the Notification interface specifies whether the notification should be silent, i.e., no sounds or vibrations should be issued, regardless of the device settings. This is specified in the silent option of the Notification() constructor.
dom-notification-silent.title: Notification: silent property

dom-notification-tag.name: tag
dom-notification-tag.summary: The tag read-only property of the Notification interface signifies an identifying tag for the notification, as specified in the tag option of the Notification() constructor.

safari_ios.notes: This property is exposed but is not implemented. See WebKit bug 258922.

dom-notification-tag.title: Notification: tag property

dom-notification-timestamp.name: timestamp
dom-notification-timestamp.summary: The timestamp read-only property of the Notification interface returns a number, as specified in the timestamp option of the Notification() constructor.
dom-notification-timestamp.title: Notification: timestamp property

dom-notification-title.name: title
dom-notification-title.summary: The title read-only property of the Notification interface indicates the title of the notification, as specified in the title parameter of the Notification() constructor.
dom-notification-title.title: Notification: title property

dom-notification-vibrate.name: vibrate
dom-notification-vibrate.summary: The vibrate read-only property of the Notification interface specifies a vibration pattern for the device's vibration hardware to emit when the notification fires. This is specified in the vibrate option of the Notification() constructor.

chrome_android.notes: Does not work on Android O or later regardless of Chrome version.

opera_android.notes: Does not work on Android O or later regardless of Chrome version.

samsunginternet_android.notes: Does not work on Android O or later regardless of Chrome version.

dom-notification-vibrate.title: Notification: vibrate property

api.name: Notification
api.summary: The Notification interface of the Notifications API is used to configure and display desktop notifications to the user.

notes: Starting in Chrome 49, notifications do not work in incognito mode.
Before Chrome 42, service worker additions were not supported.
Notifications in Chrome for Android are only available through service workers. To show notifications on Android, see ServiceWorkerRegistration.showNotification().
Starting in Chrome 49, notifications do not work in incognito mode.
Starting in Opera 36, notifications do not work in incognito mode.
Before Opera 29, service worker additions were not supported.
Notifications in Opera for Android are only available through service workers. To show notifications on Android, see ServiceWorkerRegistration.showNotification().
Starting in Opera for Android 36, notifications do not work in incognito mode.
Notifications in Samsung Internet are only available through service workers. To show notifications on Android, see ServiceWorkerRegistration.showNotification().
Starting in Samsung Internet 5.0, notifications do not work in incognito mode.
Starting in Chrome 49, notifications do not work in incognito mode.
Before Chrome 42, service worker additions were not supported.

api.title: Notification

dom-notificationevent-notificationevent.name: NotificationEvent
dom-notificationevent-notificationevent.summary: The NotificationEvent() constructor creates a new NotificationEvent object.
dom-notificationevent-notificationevent.title: NotificationEvent: NotificationEvent() constructor

ref-for-dom-notificationevent-notificati.name: notification
ref-for-dom-notificationevent-notificati.summary: The notification read-only property of the NotificationEvent interface returns the instance of the Notification that was clicked to fire the event. The Notification provides read-only access to many properties that were set at the instantiation time of the Notification such as tag and data attributes that allow you to store information for deferred use in the notificationclick event.
ref-for-dom-notificationevent-notificati.title: NotificationEvent: notification property

notificationevent.name: NotificationEvent
notificationevent.summary: The parameter passed into the onnotificationclick handler, the NotificationEvent interface represents a notification click event that is dispatched on the ServiceWorkerGlobalScope of a ServiceWorker.
notificationevent.title: NotificationEvent

activating-a-notification.name: notificationclick_event
activating-a-notification.summary: The notificationclick event is fired to indicate that a system notification spawned by ServiceWorkerRegistration.showNotification() has been clicked.
activating-a-notification.title: ServiceWorkerGlobalScope: notificationclick event

dom-serviceworkerglobalscope-onnotificat.name: notificationclick_event
dom-serviceworkerglobalscope-onnotificat.summary: The notificationclick event is fired to indicate that a system notification spawned by ServiceWorkerRegistration.showNotification() has been clicked.
dom-serviceworkerglobalscope-onnotificat.title: ServiceWorkerGlobalScope: notificationclick event

dom-serviceworkerglobalscope-onnotificat.name: notificationclose_event
dom-serviceworkerglobalscope-onnotificat.summary: The notificationclose event fires when a user closes a displayed notification spawned by ServiceWorkerRegistration.showNotification().
dom-serviceworkerglobalscope-onnotificat.title: ServiceWorkerGlobalScope: notificationclose event

dom-serviceworkerregistration-getnotific.name: getNotifications
dom-serviceworkerregistration-getnotific.summary: The getNotifications() method of the ServiceWorkerRegistration interface returns a list of the notifications in the order that they were created from the current origin via the current service worker registration. Origins can have many active but differently-scoped service worker registrations. Notifications created by one service worker on the same origin will not be available to other active services workers on that same origin.
dom-serviceworkerregistration-getnotific.title: ServiceWorkerRegistration: getNotifications() method

dom-serviceworkerregistration-shownotifi.name: showNotification
dom-serviceworkerregistration-shownotifi.summary: The showNotification() method of the ServiceWorkerRegistration interface creates a notification on an active service worker.
dom-serviceworkerregistration-shownotifi.title: ServiceWorkerRegistration: showNotification() method
